intro: Oligolobos, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant features small, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Oligolobos grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often covered in fine hairs.
